    Celerity in the `lorentz` package

Photons

photon.Rd

Various functionality to deal with the 4-momentum of a photon

Usage

is.consistent.nullvec(N,TOL=1e-10)
as.photon(x,E=1)

Arguments

N

Four-momentum to be tested for nullness

TOL

tolerance

x

Vector of three-velocities

E

Energy, a scalar

Details

Returns the four-momentum of a photon.

Author

Robin K. S. Hankin

See also

4mom,reflect

Examples


## A bunch of photons all approximately parallel to the x-axis:
as.photon(as.3vel(cbind(0.9,runif(10)/1000,runif(10)/1000)))
#>       E       p_x          p_y          p_z
#>  [1,] 1 0.9999997 0.0001753634 0.0007585135
#>  [2,] 1 0.9999995 0.0008276267 0.0004836500
#>  [3,] 1 0.9999999 0.0001850047 0.0004734916
#>  [4,] 1 0.9999992 0.0009146362 0.0008347966
#>  [5,] 1 0.9999999 0.0003596762 0.0002630787
#>  [6,] 1 0.9999991 0.0008093378 0.0010554060
#>  [7,] 1 0.9999996 0.0008944516 0.0002763641
#>  [8,] 1 0.9999997 0.0006820057 0.0004270669
#>  [9,] 1 0.9999992 0.0007074185 0.0010654642
#> [10,] 1 0.9999997 0.0006421253 0.0004791503


## mirror ball:
jj <- matrix(rnorm(30),10,3)
disco <- sweep(matrix(rnorm(30),10,3),1,sqrt(rowSums(jj^2)),`/`)
p <- as.photon(c(1,0,0))
reflect(p,disco)
#>   E         p_x          p_y        p_z
#> x 1  0.88526778  0.376151148  0.2735165
#> x 1  0.71846006 -0.579470110 -0.3847461
#> x 1  0.63881233  0.670842813  0.3766812
#> x 1  0.85882061  0.014405193  0.5120739
#> x 1 -0.25777147 -0.671540892 -0.6946846
#> x 1 -0.21371600  0.875554111  0.4332787
#> x 1  0.62601778  0.610511594 -0.4851570
#> x 1  0.35414881 -0.929245077 -0.1052721
#> x 1  0.97979083 -0.006842653 -0.1999078
#> x 1 -0.05290884  0.992016243 -0.1144746

table(reflect(p,disco)[,2]>0) # should be TRUE with probability sqrt(0.5)
#> 
#> FALSE  TRUE 
#>     3     7 

## relativistic  disco; mirror ball moves at 0.5c:

B <- boost(as.3vel(c(0.5,0,0)))
p |> tcrossprod(B) |> reflect(disco) |> tcrossprod(solve(B))
#>           t         x            y           z
#> x 0.9617559 0.9235119  0.217170967  0.15791482
#> x 0.9061534 0.8123067 -0.334557224 -0.22213324
